targeted-containers.name: Container
targeted-containers.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to open it, alternatively some of these types of items may be placed inside rooms and can then be accessed by people inside the room.

money-sink-voucher.name: Money Sink Voucher
money-sink-voucher.desc: These items can be used to purchase amazing rewards from NPCs such as the one at 32, 62 Knotwood Valley.

puzzle.name: Puzzle
puzzle.desc: Use the Dungeon Furnishing screen to place this item into a Puzzle/Question room in a dungeon you own. Players who visit this room will then have to solve the puzzle before they continue.

prize-box.name: Prize Box
prize-box.desc: Use the Dungeon Furnishing screen to place this item into a Prize room in a dungeon you own. Players who visit this room can then buy prizes for Dungeon Reward Tokens they have earnt in this or other dungeons.

money-deed.name: Money deed
money-deed.desc: Use this item from your Inventory > Containers screen to turn it from paper and apply the money to your held funds.

ranged-weapon.name: Ranged Weapon
ranged-weapon.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. You will also need to ensure you have the relevant ammunition equipped for this weapon.

ammo-materials.name: Ammo Materials
ammo-materials.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

necklace-upgrade.name: Bejewels
necklace-upgrade.desc: This item can be fitted into a neck slot item to give that item the additional bonuses shown below.

jewelry-upgrade.name: Bejewels
jewelry-upgrade.desc: This item can be fitted into either a finger slot item or a neck slot item to give that item the additional bonuses shown below.

strangers-gift.name: Strangers Gift
strangers-gift.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to receive the items the stranger left for you. This item may also be used as a small storage chest in your Inventory.

earring-upgrade.name: Bejewels
earring-upgrade.desc: This item can be fitted into a ear slot item to give that item the additional bonuses shown below.

explosive-component.name: Explosive Component
explosive-component.desc: These ingredients are used in the creation of explosives via the Inventory > Tradeskill > Seamanship crafting screens.

pirate-puzzle-prize.name: Pirate Puzzle Prize
pirate-puzzle-prize.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to receive the items the box containers.

artifact-plan.name: Artifact plan
artifact-plan.desc: This is an extremely rare  crafting plan, intended for level 1000s and above.

stealing-loot.name: Stealing Loot
stealing-loot.desc: This type of item can be found solely from stealing from a monster or player.

shrine.name: Shrine
shrine.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a Shrine Room you own, or use the Tile Items screen to place it on a tile you own, anyone who clicks on the item will be brought back to life if they are dead.

trap.name: Trap
trap.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to place it into a room or on a map tile. Traps are triggered by players entering the same location, and they have to be disarmed or triggered for the player to continue.

trash-can.name: Trash Can
trash-can.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a Room you own, anyone who can access the room can open the container and sell items to the box, the room owner will earn a small revenue from the box.

pirate-puzzle.name: Pirate Puzzle
pirate-puzzle.desc: Collect all 50 pieces of the puzzle, to unlock a fabled treasure.

training-aid.name: Training Aid
training-aid.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to learn the plan it contains.

knowledge-aid.name: Knowledge Aid
knowledge-aid.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to learn a few plans. The plans you learn are random and based on your current skills and strength of the book.

special-creature.name: Special Creature
special-creature.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to hatch a new pet, the pet will start at the same level as you. You can choose its profession and sex from a list of acceptable race settings.

building-permit.name: Building Permit
building-permit.desc: Simply owning this permit, allows you to build one building on the tile the permit is bound to, the permit is used up in the process.

lottery-ticket.name: Lottery Ticket
lottery-ticket.desc: Owning a ticket will grant you a chance of winning this weeks lottery ... typically a lottery drawing happens on a Sunday.

badge.name: Badge
badge.desc: Use this item from your inventory to add it to your active badges.

stolen-item-easy.name: Stolen Item
stolen-item-easy.desc: This item was stolen for a quest, return to the NPC that gave you the quest to complete it.

relocation-permit.name: Relocation Permit
relocation-permit.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to allow you to relocate a building to the permit is bound to.

lore-item.name: Lore Item
lore-item.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen.

statue-permit.name: Bought Extra
statue-permit.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen when standing on a tile you own, or inside a Statue Monument room you own to place a Statue. The statue can be based on any of your characters or characters on your server.

message-board.name: Message Board
message-board.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own. Tile visitors can then post messages on the board.

status-changer.name: Bought Extra
status-changer.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to be able to alter your appearance and to change the way you appear to others, you can also change the appearance of buildings.

legend-token-chest.name: Legend Token Chest
legend-token-chest.desc: Use this item by clicking on it inside a room, you will receive your rewards and the key to the next dungeon.

stolen-item-medium.name: Stolen Item
stolen-item-medium.desc: This item was stolen for a quest, return to the NPC that gave you the quest to complete it.

stolen-item-hard.name: Stolen Item
stolen-item-hard.desc: This item was stolen for a quest, return to the NPC that gave you the quest to complete it.

badge-container.name: Badge Container
badge-container.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

item-sell-box.name: Bought Extra
item-sell-box.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to be able to sell items whenever you wish without going to an NPC, very useful for selling loot if you are full and in the middle of a dungeon.

alchemy-ingredient.name: Alchemy Ingredient
alchemy-ingredient.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the Alchemy crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

2-handed-equipment.name: 2 Handed Equipment
2-handed-equipment.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

head-armour.name: Armour
head-armour.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

leg-armour.name: Armour
leg-armour.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

arm-armour.name: Armour
arm-armour.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

chest-armour.name: Armour
chest-armour.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

foot-armour.name: Armour
foot-armour.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

hand-armour.name: Armour
hand-armour.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

cloak.name: Armour
cloak.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

face-armour.name: Armour
face-armour.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

ladder.name: Ladder
ladder.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a Room you own, anyone who can access the room can then use the item to move up or down a floor.

new-crafting-resource.name: New Crafting Resource
new-crafting-resource.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

crafters-gift.name: Crafters Gift
crafters-gift.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to receive the items the stranger left for you. This item may also be used as a small storage chest in your Inventory.

scrapbook.name: Scrapbook
scrapbook.desc: This Item is a scrapbook, it contains important pictures.

resource-tailoring.name: Materials
resource-tailoring.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

vampire-potions.name: Potions
vampire-potions.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to consume the vial and gain its effects, in addition some types of vials may be used in combat via the relevant button.

ear-jewelry.name: Jewelry
ear-jewelry.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

expedition-supplies.name: Expedition Supplies
expedition-supplies.desc: Supplies that were lost or damaged during a monster attack.

guild-color.name: Guild Color
guild-color.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

combat-item.name: Combat Item
combat-item.desc: Use this item during combat via the Offensive item button.

key.name: Key
key.desc: Simply owning this item allows you to enter the room it is bound to, you may also be able to use it via the Inventory screen to travel to the room instantly.

tailoring-thread-maker.name: Tool
tailoring-thread-maker.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a compatible Room you own or a land tile. Anyone with access to it can then use the item to turn fiber into thread.

tailoring-cloth-maker.name: Tool
tailoring-cloth-maker.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a compatible Room you own or a land tile. Anyone with access to it can then use the item to turn thread into cloth.

tailoring-raw-material.name: Raw Materials
tailoring-raw-material.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to turn the fiber into thread (requires Tailoring skill) or look for a Spinning wheel.

treasure-clue.name: Treasure Clue
treasure-clue.desc: This item is a clue used to recover a lost treasure of Myzan.

rawfood.name: Ingredient
rawfood.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

food.name: Food
food.desc:
Use this item from your Inventory screen to consume the food and gain its effects, in addition some types of food may be used in combat via the relevant button.

If you use the Savor button on the Consume screen you can gain higher effects than those listed here.

fish.name: Raw Materials
fish.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

treasure-hunter-tool.name: Treasure Hunter tool
treasure-hunter-tool.desc: This item is used from your Inventory to uncover clues to long lost treasures!

world-lockpick-spawn.name: World Lockpick Spawn
world-lockpick-spawn.desc: Clicking on a locked box in a building will attempt to open it, you will need Lockpicking skill.

mini-vault.name: Mini Vault
mini-vault.desc: This item can be used from your Inventory screen, using the item allows you to move items in and out of your bank vault without visiting the bank.

item-drop-box.name: Item Drop Box
item-drop-box.desc: This item can be placed inside a room using the Furnishing skill and items deposited inside for the owner of the room.

ancient-relic-container.name: Relic Container
ancient-relic-container.desc: An ancient relic ... long thought lost.

rogue-training-device.name: Rogue Training Device
rogue-training-device.desc: This item is a training device, the box starts locked and can be picked by a rogue to raise lockpicking skill once unlocked it can be used from your inventory to attempt to raise Stealing skill.

food-cooker.name: Tool
food-cooker.desc: This item is a tool used in Cooking, tools do not need to be equipped to be used on a Tradeskill screen however you will need high enough skill to use it. Equipping this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen may improve your skill value.

anniversary-gift.name: Anniversary Gift
anniversary-gift.desc: This item can be placed on a land tile, by a land tile owner.

resource-stone-masonry.name: Materials
resource-stone-masonry.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

magic-vial.name: Potions
magic-vial.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to activate whatever effect it might have.

wrist-jewelry.name: Jewelry
wrist-jewelry.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

legend-key.name: Legend Key
legend-key.desc: This key is used to open a locked chest inside one of the Legend Dungeons.

skill-maximizer.name: Skill Maximizer
skill-maximizer.desc: This item can be used to allow you to maximize one of your skills without putting the effort into raising it manually.

house-resource-stone.name: Raw Materials
house-resource-stone.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

healing-resource.name: Healing Aid
healing-resource.desc: Use this item when in combat and if you have the First-Aid skill you can heal yourself of damage.

player-training-ticket.name: Training Ticket
player-training-ticket.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to choose a different class path. You can not change from the main base classes i.e. a Shaman to a Paladin but you can choose a different class  in the base class you started as.

ring-upgrade.name: Bejewels
ring-upgrade.desc: This item can be fitted into a finger slot item to give that item the additional bonuses shown below.

starting-container.name: Starting Container
starting-container.desc: Use this item to gain your starting items and equipment.

magic-potion-other.name: Potions
magic-potion-other.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to consume the potion and gain its effects, in addition some potions may be used in combat via the relevant button.

dungeon-key.name: Dungeon Key
dungeon-key.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen and a dungeon will be magically created at the tile you are on, these Key Dungeons last no more than two days.

unknown-relic.name: Relic
unknown-relic.desc: This relic needs to be cleaned up with Archaeology before you can begin to comprehend its purpose.

spawner.name: Spawner
spawner.desc: Use this item to receive a random item.

good-spawner.name: Spawner
good-spawner.desc: Use this item to receive a good item.

ammo-weapons-bullets.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-bullets.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Gun weapons.

ammo-weapons-organic.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-organic.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Organic weapons.

flower-respawner.name: Respawner
flower-respawner.desc: Place this item in an Arboretum and then use it every 30minutes to gain fresh flowers!

fruit-respawner.name: Respawner
fruit-respawner.desc: Place this item in an Arboretum and then use it every 20minutes to gain fresh Fruit!

gems.name: Raw Materials
gems.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the Stonemasonry crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

rare-spawner.name: Spawner
rare-spawner.desc: Use this item to receive a rare item.

quest-item.name: Quest Item
quest-item.desc: This item is needed for a quest, return to the NPC that gave you the quest. Check the Character > Quests screen for more information.

polymorpher.name: Polymorpher
polymorpher.desc: This item can be placed in a special building room. An Arboretum, which can be constructed using the construction skill.

jurassic-resource.name: Jurassic Resource
jurassic-resource.desc: Use this item to gain a spell effect. May also be required for certain trophy quests.

ammo-weapons-rocks.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-rocks.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Rock weapons.

marine-tool.name: Tool
marine-tool.desc: This resource is gathered using Marine Husbandry when in the Shrouded Islands.

ammo-weapons-darts.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-darts.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Blowpipe weapons.

glasses-shades.name: Jewelry
glasses-shades.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

jurassic-voucher.name: Jurassic Voucher
jurassic-voucher.desc: Certain NPCs in Jurassic Wars take these items as payment for goods and services.

reaper-symbol.name: Allegiance Symbol
reaper-symbol.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

society-symbol.name: Allegiance Symbol
society-symbol.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

offensive-item.name: Offensive Item
offensive-item.desc: This type of item can be used on an enemy ship during combat.

forehead.name: Clothing
forehead.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

stomach.name: Stomach
stomach.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

shoulders.name: Armour
shoulders.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

exile-symbol.name: Allegiance Symbol
exile-symbol.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

log.name: Raw Materials
log.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to turn it into planks (if you have Lumberjacking skill) or find a Chopping Block/Saw.

special-slot.name: Special Slot
special-slot.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

bonus-slot.name: Bonus Slot
bonus-slot.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

log-chopping-tool.name: Tool
log-chopping-tool.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own. Visitors can then use this tool to chop logs without needing Lumberjacking skill, however you get less planks and no experience.

signpost.name: Signpost
signpost.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own.

necromancy.name: Necromancy
necromancy.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to envoke the undead minion from the deepest darkest regions of the underworld so that it comes forth to be your pet.

siege-weapon.name: Siege Weapon
siege-weapon.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. Siege weapons can be used to siege Allegiance outposts you will also need the correct type of ammo equipped.

catapult-ammo.name: Siege Ammo
catapult-ammo.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Catapult siege weapons.

bank-vault.name: Vault
bank-vault.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a compatible Room you own or a compatible land tile. Anyone with access to the room can then access their Bank Vault.

storage-box.name: Container
storage-box.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a compatible Room you own. Anyone with access to the room can then store items within this container.

portal.name: Portal
portal.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen, it will teleport you to a specific destination.

monster-spawner.name: Monster Spawner
monster-spawner.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to hatch a new pet, the pets Sex and Profession will be random.

trading-card.name: Trading Card
trading-card.desc: This card is covered by a protective magic shield that prevents it from getting scratched, dented or covered in food stains. It also prevents you from showing off with it ... use the card from your Inventory screen to add it to your card list.

trading-card-folder.name: Trading Card Folder
trading-card-folder.desc:
Use this item from your Inventory screen to view the cards you have (same as File > Your Trading Cards screen).

Click the Link button on the Inventory screen to send a clickable link to chat, so everyone can view the cards you own.

bag.name: Bag
bag.desc: Equip this item to one of your first five bag slots via the Inventory > Equipment screen to increase the amount of items you can carry and enable you to access this bag for easy item storage.

profession-portal.name: Profession Portal
profession-portal.desc: Use this item to teleport somewhere.

soul-gems.name: Soul Gem
soul-gems.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen if you have Transmigration skill it will release the spirit and give it physical form once more, alternatively building owners can place soul gems inside spawn rooms and the entrance room of a building.

training-saddle.name: Tool
training-saddle.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to train a pet for riding.

vegetable-respawner.name: Respawner
vegetable-respawner.desc: Place this item in an Arboretum and then use it every 20minutes to gain vegetables and spices!

pet-training-ticket.name: Training Ticket
pet-training-ticket.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen, it will allow you to choose a pet and then select the class the pet should be.

siege-weapon-construction-tool.name: Tool
siege-weapon-construction-tool.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

ammo-weapons-potions.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-potions.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Scoop weapons.

hide-preparing-tool.name: Tool
hide-preparing-tool.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own. Visitors can then use this tool to prepare hides without needing Leatherworking skill, however you get less hides and no experience.

flag-transporter.name: Flag Transporter
flag-transporter.desc: This item is used to teleport from a dungeon into a flag room.

pet-bonus-item.name: Pet Bonus Item
pet-bonus-item.desc: This item can be equipped to your pets bonus slot. Not equippable by players.

potion-binding-solution.name: Ingredient
potion-binding-solution.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

flag-stand.name: Flag Stand
flag-stand.desc: Place a flag on the stand to capture an island.

voucher.name: Voucher
voucher.desc: If you visit a Prize Chest inside a Prize Room in a player dungeon you can redeem this item to gain a reward. A token works for any prize chest, regardless of if it is from the same dungeon.

ore.name: Raw Materials
ore.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to turn it into ingots (if you have Blacksmithing skill) or find a Forge.

tailoring-thread-material.name: Materials
tailoring-thread-material.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

resource-harvester.name: Tool
resource-harvester.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a compatible Room you own. Using the Furnishing skill it can then be automated to produce resources ... each time it is emptied its resource capacity goes down and when it hits 0 you will have to replace it with another item.

portal-ii.name: Materials
portal-ii.desc: Use a marked portalstone from the World > Open Portal screen or via the Inventory screen to open a new portal to the portalstones bound location.

house-furniture.name: Furnishing
house-furniture.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a compatible Room you own. Anyone with access to the room can then use the placed item.

neck.name: Armour
neck.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

paintings.name: Paintings
paintings.desc: Paintings can be placed inside the Galleria room/building. You need to get a Construction deed made to use this item.

ritual-resource.name: Ritual Resource
ritual-resource.desc: These items are used in Demonology rituals, to conduct a ritural you need to be a Warlock and seek out a Demonic Site.

museum-relic.name: Museum Relic
museum-relic.desc: This item is a forgotten relic, it was thought lost but recently surfaced.

1-handed-equipment.name: 1 Handed Equipment
1-handed-equipment.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

relocation-tool.name: Bought Extra
relocation-tool.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to allow you to relocate a building from one tile to another.

special-chest.name: Loot
special-chest.desc: Unlock this item from the Inventory screen (if you have Lockpicking skill) or use the Master Key (bought extra) or visit a Locksmith in a town such as Northglen. Then use the item from your inventory to empty its contents out into your Inventory.

unlocking-tool.name: Bought Extra
unlocking-tool.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to be able to unlock locked items such as Battered Chests.

rennovation-deeds.name: Rennovation Deed
rennovation-deeds.desc: Using the rennovate screen you can expand your building by selecting this deed or upgrade an existing room to this type.

trophy-case.name: Furnishing
trophy-case.desc: Place this item into a Museum room to allow you to show off your trophies.

crafted-vessel-flag.name: Crafted Vessel Flag
crafted-vessel-flag.desc: Use this item from your inventory then choose a vessel and apply the flag to that vessel.

special-bag.name: Special Bag
special-bag.desc: Equip this item to your sixth bag slot ia the Inventory > Equipment screen to increase the amount of items you can carry and enable you to access this bag for easy item storage.

duty-item.name: Duty Item
duty-item.desc: This is a special item that can be turned in for fame and is gained only with the Duty skill.

trophy-eastern.name: Trophy
trophy-eastern.desc: This is a Trophy Item, Trophy Items are generally used in quests such as the Trophy Collection guild quests.

joke.name: Joke
joke.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to read a joke.

golem.name: Golem
golem.desc: Use this item from your inventory to construct a complete golem.

golem-parts.name: Golem Parts
golem-parts.desc: Use this part with the Animation crafting skill to make Golems and in some cases other Animation parts.

camping-equipment.name: Camping Equipment
camping-equipment.desc: Use this item from your Inventory or via a shortcut, it will allow you to rest and grant you with a combat Regeneration bonus to Health, Mana and Stamina.

arena-dungeon-key.name: Arena key
arena-dungeon-key.desc: Use this key from your inventory when in Eternal Plains to create an Arena Dungeon.

irellian-quest-item.name: Eternal Plains Item
irellian-quest-item.desc:
This is a trophy quest item that someone at one of the Irellian Towns will accept.

Kill monsters north of the river to gain more of these.

subterran-quest-item.name: Eternal Plains Item
subterran-quest-item.desc:
This is a trophy quest item that someone at one of the Subterran Towns will accept.

Kill monsters south of the river to gain more of these.

wings.name: Wings
wings.desc: Equip this item to your special Back slot. To receive the bonuses it contains.

consumable-container.name: Consumable Container
consumable-container.desc: Use this item from your inventory to retrieve the food or drink contained within.

halloween-2007.name: Halloween 2007
halloween-2007.desc: This item was given out at Halloween 2007, it is a collectible.

fireworks.name: Fireworks
fireworks.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to set off a fireworks display on the current tile. Please keep all pets inside and have a bucket of sand or water ready incase of emergencies.

locks.name: Locks
locks.desc: Using the Building Lock screen or Item Lock screen you can fit a lock into an item or building, the level of the item will determine the strength of the lock.

marine-resource.name: Raw Materials
marine-resource.desc: This resource is gathered using the Marine Husbandry skill, via various marine traps littered around the realm.

courier-item.name: Bought Extra
courier-item.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to be able to send Bought extras and other items to characters on your account.

other.name: Tool
other.desc: Use this item from the Inventory screen to see if it does anything.

ring.name: Jewelry
ring.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

neck-clothing.name: Clothing
neck-clothing.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen. In addition if it has a spell on it you can activate the spell via the Inventory > Spells screen after you have equipped it.

book.name: Book
book.desc: Use this item from the Inventory screen to read its contents and to add notes and make changes.

scroll.name: Scroll
scroll.desc: Use this item from the Inventory screen if you have the required magic skill and skill value you will be able to learn the spell. Only natural value is considered so having an item equipped to get enough skill does not count.

ammo-weapons-bows.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-bows.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Bow weapons.

ammo-weapons-crossbows.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-crossbows.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Crossbow weapons.

resource-smithing.name: Materials
resource-smithing.desc: This item can be used in Blacksmithing, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

resource-woodworking.name: Materials
resource-woodworking.desc: This item can be used in Carpentry, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

magic-potion.name: Potions
magic-potion.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to consume the potion and gain its effects, in addition some potions may be used in combat via the relevant button.

potion-containers.name: Magic Potions
potion-containers.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the relevant crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

trophy.name: Trophy
trophy.desc: This is a Trophy Item, Trophy Items are generally used in quests such as the Trophy Collection guild quests.

house-deeds.name: House Deed
house-deeds.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to build a brand new building. The type of building that is constructed is based on the deed.

smithing-smelting-tool.name: Tool
smithing-smelting-tool.desc: This item is a tool used in Blacksmithing, tools do not need to be equipped to be used on a Tradeskill screen however you will need high enough skill to use it. Equipping this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen may improve your skill value.

island-flag.name: Island Flag
island-flag.desc: This flag is used to capture an Island.

treasure-map.name: Map
treasure-map.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to view the location the treasure map points to. To dig up the treasure you need to Equip a spade (which requires Mining skill) then goto the location of the treasure and click the Dig button.

costume-box.name: Costume Box
costume-box.desc: Use this item from your inventory to remove the costume pieces inside.

hide.name: Raw Materials
hide.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to turn hides into prepared hides, or use the relevant Leatherworking plan. In both cases you need Leatherworking skill.

creature.name: Creature
creature.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to hatch a new pet, the pet will start at the same level as you. You can choose its profession and sex from a list of acceptable race settings.

ram-ammo.name: Siege Ammo
ram-ammo.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Battering Ram weapons.

tile-claim.name: Bought Extra
tile-claim.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to be able to claim unclaimed land tiles in the Lands of Myzan.

balista-ammo.name: Siege Ammo
balista-ammo.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Balista siege weapons.

ammo-weapons-artillery.name: Ammo
ammo-weapons-artillery.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen when using Heavy Weapons such as Artillery.

imprint.name: Imprint
imprint.desc: Use this item from your inventory to apply a specific effect to a weapon, be it a poison, imprinted spell or another effect. This will give the weapon a special effect in combat.

disguise-kit.name: Disguise Kit
disguise-kit.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to take on the disguise.

strangers-gift-ii.name: Strangers Gift
strangers-gift-ii.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to open it and access the contents.

christmas-tree.name: Christmas Tree
christmas-tree.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own.

trinket.name: Trinket
trinket.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen and you might find something strange happens.

present-box.name: Present Box
present-box.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to receive a random present.

vendor-upgrade.name: Bought Extra
vendor-upgrade.desc: Use this item from your Inventory to upgrade your Vendor pets to have a larger storage capacity.

teaching-aid.name: Bought Extra
teaching-aid.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen and then choose which Plans you wish to learn.

quest-list-item.name: Quest List Item
quest-list-item.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own.

public-storage-box.name: Container
public-storage-box.desc: Use the Furnishing screen to place this item into a Room you own, anyone who can access the room can open the container.

resupply-box.name: Outpost Supply Box
resupply-box.desc: Use this item from your Inventory screen to resupply an Outpost or Fort and complete a quest.

automation-tool.name: Automation Tool
automation-tool.desc: This item can not be equipped, use it from your inventory to remotely administer automations.

pet-chest.name: Loot
pet-chest.desc: Unlock this item from the Inventory screen (if you have Lockpicking skill) or use the Master Key (bought extra) or visit a Locksmith in a town such as Northglen. Then use the item from your inventory to empty its contents out into your Inventory.

boss-trophy.name: Boss Trophy
boss-trophy.desc: This is a special boss trophy item gained from killing a boss.

bonus-2.name: Bonus 2
bonus-2.desc: Equip this item via the Inventory > Equipment screen.

pet-bought-bonus.name: Pet Bonus 2
pet-bought-bonus.desc: Equip this item to your pet via the Minions > Manage - Equip screen.

flower.name: Flower
flower.desc: These beautiful flowers can be traded as a gift or used in Floristry to make more beautiful arrangements.

seeds-and-soil.name: Seeds and Soil
seeds-and-soil.desc: Seeds and Soil are both ingredients used in the Floristry crafting skill via Inventory > Tradeskills > Floristry.

dragon-polymorphers.name: Dragon Polymorphers
dragon-polymorphers.desc: Used to polymorph your appearance into something else.

barter-items.name: Barter Items
barter-items.desc: This item can be used to barter with the NPCs at 50, 50 Eastern Lands.

quest-marker.name: Quest Marker
quest-marker.desc: This item is a clue to completing a quest.

world-relic.name: World Relic
world-relic.desc: Special world relic, can be placed on a land tile you own.

dung-pile.name: Dung Pile
dung-pile.desc: A special item that is left behind when a Dragon goes potty.

pet-equipment-box.name: Pet Equipment Box
pet-equipment-box.desc: This is a bought extra item, use it from your Inventory then select a pet and it will spawn a full set of equipment in that pets inventory.

star-metal.name: Star Metal
star-metal.desc: A precious piece of metal that is said to be part of a star.

transmogrification-trigger.name: Transmogrification
transmogrification-trigger.desc: Use this item from your inventory, it will allow you to transmute many materials into a lower form. A nice extra for those who do not have Alchemy.

advertising-items.name: Advertisement
advertising-items.desc: Having this item in your inventory will allow you enhanced advertising on the Marketeer when trading goods to vendors.

star-metal-tracker.name: Star Metal Tracker
star-metal-tracker.desc: Create a shortcut to this item or use it from your inventory to show the star metal tracking screen.

constellation-chooser.name: Constellation Chooser
constellation-chooser.desc: Allows you to gain additional constellation rewards.

telescope.name: Telescope
telescope.desc: Allows you to look into the sky.

junk.name: Junk
junk.desc: Junk for selling or bragging rights only ... may contain nuts.

demonic-trophy.name: Demonic Trophy
demonic-trophy.desc: A trophy item dropped by a demon.

bane.name: Bane
bane.desc: This corrupted item will increase the damage dealt to a certain race when applied to a weapon.

pack-rat.name: Pack Rat
pack-rat.desc: Using this item from your inventory will allow you to fetch items from your storage chests.

weather-machine.name: Weather machine
weather-machine.desc: Fill this weather machine with crystals then set it off!

demon-key.name: Demon Key
demon-key.desc: Opens the way into the Demon Realm.

self-restoration.name: Self Restoration
self-restoration.desc: Bring yourself back to life again.

spellbound.name: Spellbound
spellbound.desc: Use this item from your inventory to fit it into an item to provide enhanced buffs.

charm-ingredient.name: Charm  Ingredient
charm-ingredient.desc: This item can be used in a tradeskill, use the Charms and Hexes crafting screen and if you have enough skill this item will be available as an ingredient.

christmas-item.name: Christmas Item
christmas-item.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own.

chocolate-statue.name: Chocoate Statue
chocolate-statue.desc: Use the item Tile Management screen to place this item on a tile you own.

lifestream.name: Lifestream
lifestream.desc: Use/Click on this item to view the status of the Afterlife Lifestream.

map-tile-extender.name: Map Tile Extender
map-tile-extender.desc: Use this item from your inventory when standing on a tile you own, it will increase the amount of items that can be placed on the tile.

darkness-quencher.name: Darkness Quencher
darkness-quencher.desc: Interact with this item to weaken the Darkness.

quenching-crystal.name: Quenching crystal
quenching-crystal.desc: Used with a Darkness quencher to weaken the power of Darkness.

magic-mirror.name: Magic Mirror
magic-mirror.desc: An ancient relic used to find the fairest person of them all.

specimen-jar.name: Specimen Jar
specimen-jar.desc: If you trap a specimen in the Afterlife you will need an empty specimen jar.

light-beacon.name: Light Beacon
light-beacon.desc: Use this item from your inventory, it should bring light to even the darkest reaches.

pedestal-scrapbook.name: Pedestal Scrapbook
pedestal-scrapbook.desc: This item can be placed inside a Museum room.

training-trophy.name: Training Trophy
training-trophy.desc: Use this item from your inventory as you try to collect all 9 pieces of this puzzle.

jewelry-box.name: Jewelry Box
jewelry-box.desc: This is a bought extra item, use it from your Inventory and it will create a special set of 5 jewelry pieces.

potion-combination.name: Potion Combiner
potion-combination.desc: This item lets you combine potions together ... who knows what will happen.

clock.name: Clock
clock.desc: This item lets you keep a check on time!

advertising-poster.name: Advertising Poster
advertising-poster.desc: This item lets you place an advert on the Tiny Tim advertising system.

lordship-furniture.name: Lordship Furniture
lordship-furniture.desc: These types of items can be placed into Lordship buildings and allow you to upgrade your buildings to increase your peasant and lordship rating.

stargate.name: Stargate
stargate.desc: This bought extra allows you to link buildings and dungeons together.

lordship-improvements.name: Lordship Improvements
lordship-improvements.desc: Fitted to a Lordship building via the Property > Manage screen these items generally help[ improve the overall happiness of your tenants.

dark-depths-control-crystal.name: Dark Depths Control Crystal
dark-depths-control-crystal.desc: Provides a unique effect inside the Dark Depths dungeon.

item-use-door.name: Item Use Door
item-use-door.desc: Allows someone with the correct item to pass.

pet-weapon-box.name: Pet Weapon Box
pet-weapon-box.desc: This is a bought extra item, use it from your Inventory then select a pet and it will spawn a full set of weaponst in that pets inventory.

dark-depths-recycletron.name: Dark Depths Recycletron
dark-depths-recycletron.desc: Recycles items into components used in the construction of the Dark Depths.

dark-depths-spawner.name: Dark Depths Spawner
dark-depths-spawner.desc: Use this item to receive a good item.

key-chain.name: Key Chain
key-chain.desc: Equip this item to your seventh bag slot via the Inventory > Equipment screen to increase the amount of items you can carry and enable you to stow your keys.

paint-pots.name: Paint Pots
paint-pots.desc: As well as being used in a couple of Dark Depth Quests you can use this item to paint temporary messages on a tile.

relic-trigger.name: Relic Trigger
relic-trigger.desc: Danger, this item was made by a drunken Goblin!

grenade.name: Grenade
grenade.desc: Used as an offensive item in combat to deal area effect damage.

skill-training-deed.name: Deed
skill-training-deed.desc: Use this item from your inventory to learn a new skill of your choosing. Skill choice based on pre-determined list.

gladiator-altar.name: Altar
gladiator-altar.desc: This item exists on a world map tile in the Gladiator Realm only.

skill-maxing-deed.name: Deed
skill-maxing-deed.desc: Use this item from your inventory to max out a weapon skill of your choosing. Skill choice based on known skills.

cookie-spawner.name: Cookie Spawner
cookie-spawner.desc: Use this item from your inventory to summon a Cookie Devourer!

sword-in-the-stone.name: Sword in the Stone
sword-in-the-stone.desc: Click on the Sword on the ground to begin your trial.

family-pack-box.name: Family Pack Box
family-pack-box.desc: Use this item to gain your family pack items.

augment.name: Augments
augment.desc: This item can only be fitted into blanks made with the Augmenting skill.

artifact-key.name: Key
artifact-key.desc: Use this key with the correct Artifact inside an Artifact Keep to gain control of the Artifact for your Allegiance.

food-combination.name: Food Combiner
food-combination.desc: This fine item lets you combine a main course, a dessert and a drink together ... who knows what will happen.

biting-item.name: Bought Extra
biting-item.desc: Use this item from your inventory to try to bite a player.

dragon-food-items.name: Dragon Food Items
dragon-food-items.desc: This item is intended for use in dragon combat in the Eastern Promise expansion pack only.
